WavefuncsSolver API¶

Solvers¶

Module used to solve onedimensional timeindependent Schroedinger equations using a set of data from a given file.

solvers.expected_values(interpdata, normwf, x_val, eigval)¶
Calculates the expected values for the given
wavefunctions, eigenenergies and potentials.
Parameters:
  • list with range and number of points to interpolate (interpdata) –
  • ndarray of wavefunctions (normwf) –
  • list of x values (x_val) –
  • list of eigenenergies (eigval) –
Returns:

expected x values and its standard diviation for the respectiv wavefunctions.
solvers.input_reader(filedir)¶

Collects data from the file the user iputs whitch is used to solve the wavefunction in the solvers module.

Parameters:directory of the inputfile (filedir) –
Returns:mass, interpdata, methode, potar, eigmin, eigmax used in solving the schroedinger equation.
solvers.potential_interpolate(interpdata, methode, potar)¶
interpolates the potentail for a new range of x values from a
given set of potentails.
Parameters:
  • list with range and number of points to interpolate (interpdata) –
  • methode of interpolation (methode) –
  • 2darray of x and potential values (potar) –
Returns:

the interpolated potentials and their x values as ndarray.
solvers.run(filedir, path)¶

Calculates the eigenvalues, wavefunctions, expected values and the interpolated potentials then returns the result in respectiv files.

Parameters:
  • directory of the inputfile (filedir) –
  • directory path where data will be stored. (path) –
Returns:

four files into the output folder
solvers.schroedinger_equation_solver(mass, interpdata, potential, eigmin, eigmax)¶

Solves the schroedingerequation from a given set of potentials.

Parameters:
  • Mass of the partical (mass) –
  • list with range and number of points to interpolate (interpdata) –
  • 2darray of x and potential values after interpolation (potential) –
  • minimal amount of calculated Eigenvalues (eigmin) –
  • maximum amount of calculatzed Eigenvalues (eigmax) –
Returns:

Eigenvalues and their normalized wavefunctions as ndarray.

Visualization¶

Visualization of the data retrived by the solvers module.

visualization.run(path)¶

Interface for user to define plot ranges and scaling and visualizes data.

Parameters:directory path form whitch to use data (path) –
visualization.visualization(path, pary=None, parx=None)¶

Visualizes the wavefunctions and eigenenergies for a given potential as well as the expected x values in a graph as well as the diviations of the x values. The solvers output files are being used.

Parameters:
  • directory path form whitch to use data (path) –
  • tuple disclosing the range of the y-axis (pary) –
  • tuple disclosing the range of the x-axis (parx) –

Communicator¶

Retrives data for the solvers module from the files given by the user.

communicator.main()¶

Solves the Schrödingerequation from a file containing data and outputs files with the eigenenergies, wavefunctions, interpolated potentials and expected values also visualizing the solution.
